msDesc.head: Conrad Holtnicker of Saxony, Sermones. Germany, s. xiv1.

msItem.note: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1202–1215. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

msItem.author: Conrad Holtnicker
msItem.title: Sermons
msItem.note: Selection (pr. as Bonaventure, Paris 1521, etc.; Schneyer, Wegweiser, 224; Schneyer 1. 748–777, citing the present MS. at pp. 764 & 778; Distelbrink 208). For full listing see the printed catalogue.
Sermones de tempore (Schneyer 1. 748–764, citing the present MS. at p. 764).
Sermones de communi sanctorum (Schneyer 1. 771–777, citing the present MS. at p. 778).

msItem.author: St Augustine of Hippo
msItem.title: Extracts
msItem.note: For full listing, see printed catalogue.

supportDesc.support: parchment; sometimes remnants of medieval repair (stitching holes). Bookmarks made of red-coloured leather strips, glued to both sides of the outer margins of fols 29, 59 & 90 (the latter two damaged), to distinguish (fol. 29) winter- from summertime and to mark the beginning of (fol. 59) Sanctorale and (fol. 90) Communale. (fol. 103v) One, (fol. 104r & v) two small rust marks at the centre of the outer margin, from the fore-edge catch or anchor plate of a previous binding.
supportDesc.foliation: i, 1–105, in modern (19th-cent.) pencil. The blanks between fols 89a & 90 originally unfoliated and are now numbered 89b to 89a.
supportDesc.collation: i–iv 10 | v 8 | vi–viii 10 | ix & x 8 | xi 10 | xii 6-1.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruling in lead point; two columns of 32–40, mostly 39 lines. Ruled space c.146–54 91–95

handDesc.handNote: German textualis, s. xiv1, by four hands: 1) (fols 1ra–8ra, l. 26); 2) (fols 8ra, l. 27–9vb, l. 3; 22vb, l. 32–73rb); 3) (fols 9vb, l. 4–22vb, l. 31); 4) (fols 73va–89avb, 90ra–103rb). (fols 103va–104rb) Item 2: addition in a contemporary hand. (fol. 104v) Item 3: written in bastarda s. xv, in a hand from the Mainz Charterhouse.

decoDesc.decoNote: Coloured initials in red; (fol. 1ra) secondarily decorated with fleuronnée.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Archbp. Laud, 1637–1639

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the late 14th-cent. ex-libris inscription at the upper margin of fol. 1r, following the title, and framed: ‘... et est carthusiensium moguncie’, and the 15th-cent. ex-libris inscription at the upper margin of fol. 104v: ‘Iste liber est fratrum Cartusiensium prope Magunciam’.
William Laud, 1573–1645: Ex-libris, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. i verso.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 344 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 44

listBibl.head: Published descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue, 2 vols. (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1202–1215

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Mainz digitization project to include additional information from Mairhofer catalogue.
